title: Go get one
text:
This gaming mousepad works exactly as expected. The surface is very smooth and provides excellent tracking for both gaming and everyday use. My mouse movement feels precise and consistent.

The pad stays flat on the desk and doesn’t slide around, even during long gaming sessions. The material feels durable and hasn’t shown any wear so far.

For the price, this is a great-quality mousepad and a solid upgrade from a basic one. I’d definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable gaming mousepad.

title: One of the best for plug and play
text: The sysytem works great, and the controllers start out spectacular... the reasons there is not a fifth star are as follows: the aformentioned controller starts showing stick drift just after about a year, and the replacement controllers are not cheap. Furthermore, like all systems these days, you have to pay for a service to play most of the online games with your friends. Finally, and this is a big pet peeve for me, the system gets updates to block the use of most 3rd party accessories. If you can afford to spend extra, and have the skills to get your settings right,  a PC is much better in the long run. If you need plug and play convenience, the PS5 is what's best for you.
author: Jimmy

badges.badgeDescription: This reviewer received promo considerations or sweepstakes entry for writing a review.
We’ve verified that this content was written by people who purchased this item at Best Buy.

title: It's a PS5, it plays awesome games awesomely.
text: Sony is really taking and holding the lead in the console wars.  I bought a PS5 for my son, and one for my fiancé and myself.  Both work pretty much exactly as expected.  My only issue is not as much a problem with the device, but the fact that to play a lot of game you really need PSN, and PSN has gotten insanely expensive, especially when you have to buy two,  Oh, and do yourself a favor and add the PS VR5 headset and have a blast transporting yourself to new worlds!
